Notes: "FOXP2, a gene implicated in a human speech and language disorder, has been suggested to contribute to language evolution."
"Spoken language and bipedalism are two behavioral traits that distinguish humans from other living apes."

"Foxp1 redundantly regulate endochondral ossification during embryonic development."

"Our findings also indicate that Foxp2 helps to regulate strength and length of hind limbs and maintenance of joint cartilage and intervertebral discs, which are all anatomical features that are susceptible to adaptations for bipedal locomotion."
